 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }

 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">

          </button>

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Inside Function NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError<span class="line"><!---->Inside Function NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError<!----></span><br>On line 111 [codeptr](<span class="line"><!---->On line 111 [codeptr](<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=eed8e2118e9dd38400dbaa587adf8d2af5d576bc;l=112<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=eed8e2118e9dd38400dbaa587adf8d2af5d576bc;l=112"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=eed8e2118e9dd38400dbaa587adf8d2af5d576bc;l=112<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>The pending_promises_ are resolved in such a way that a user javascript can triggered and can invalidate range based iterator by inserting / erasing a resolver. <span class="line"><!---->The pending_promises_ are resolved in such a way that a user javascript can triggered and can invalidate range based iterator by inserting / erasing a resolver. <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError() {<span class="line"><!---->void NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError() {<!----></span><br>  device_api_service_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  device_api_service_.reset();<!----></span><br><br>  // We should reset managed configuration service only it actually got<span class="line"><!---->  // We should reset managed configuration service only it actually got<!----></span><br>  // disconnected.<span class="line"><!---->  // disconnected.<!----></span><br>  if (managed_configuration_service_.is_bound() &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (managed_configuration_service_.is_bound() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      !managed_configuration_service_.is_connected()) {<span class="line"><!---->      !managed_configuration_service_.is_connected()) {<!----></span><br>    managed_configuration_service_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->    managed_configuration_service_.reset();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  // Resolve all pending promises with a failure.<span class="line"><!---->  // Resolve all pending promises with a failure.<!----></span><br>  for (ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver : pending_promises_) { /**** 1 ****/<span class="line"><!---->  for (ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver : pending_promises_) { /**** 1 ****/<!----></span><br>    resolver->Reject(<span class="line"><!---->    resolver-&gt;Reject(<!----></span><br>        MakeGarbageCollected<DOMException>(DOMExceptionCode::kNotAllowedError,<span class="line"><!---->        MakeGarbageCollected&lt;DOMException&gt;(DOMExceptionCode::kNotAllowedError,<!----></span><br>                                           kNotHighTrustedAppExceptionMessage));<span class="line"><!---->                                           kNotHighTrustedAppExceptionMessage));<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Here's a reference issue. <span class="line"><!---->Here's a reference issue. <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773<!----></a> and old bug by sergei.<span class="line"><!----> and old bug by sergei.<!----></span><br><br>A proposed fix for this issue is we can create a set of local variable and swap the pending_promises_. <span class="line"><!---->A proposed fix for this issue is we can create a set of local variable and swap the pending_promises_. <!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [99.0.4844.51] + [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [99.0.4844.51] + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: [All expect android]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [All expect android]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->3. Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<span class="line"><!---->5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<!----></span><br>6. OnServiceConnectionError gets called, which tries to reset the api's managed_configuration_service and device_api_service, and then iterates over pending_promises_. and do Reject() which it can call v8 script which can invalidate the iterator by calling getManagedConfiguration again. (NOTE: however OnServiceConnectionError never clears the pending_promise_.) which i think it should after all promises are resolved.<span class="line"><!---->6.         The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->comment #2<!----></a> seems a valid fix.<span class="line"><!----> seems a valid fix.<!----></span><br><br>More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <span class="line"><!---->More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <!----></span>https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md"><!---->https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<span class="line"><!---->It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<!----></span><br>- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<span class="line"><!---->- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<!----></span><br>- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<span class="line"><!---->- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can be triggered on any platform because, the only thing required to trigger the bug is accesing the readonly attribute NavigatorManagedData managed. <span class="line"><!---->@anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div class="issue-diff">

          Assigned
          (was: Fixed)

        It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<span class="line"><!---->Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<!----></span><br><br>The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<span class="line"><!---->The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        > 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<!----></span><br><br>The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <span class="line"><!---->The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <!----></span>crbug.com/1310338#c10<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1310338#c10" title="Security: UAF in BaseAudioContext::PerformCleanupOnMainThread"><!---->crbug.com/1310338#c10<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>> 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<!----></span><br><br>Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <span class="line"><!---->Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <!----></span>issue 1106773<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773" title="Security: Use-after-free in USB::OnServiceConnectionError"><!---->issue 1106773<!----></a>) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<span class="line"><!---->) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<!----></span><br><br>> 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<!----></span><br><br>No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<span class="line"><!---->No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

unnecessary protection logic when promises are rejected<!----></span><br><br>It is unnecessary to copy the pending promises when they are rejected.<span class="line"><!---->It is unnecessary to copy            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        </span>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <mr-edit-description id="edit-description"></mr-edit-description>
        <mr-move-copy-issue id="move-copy-issue"></mr-move-copy-issue>

 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */

    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

    line-height: 1.6;
  }

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

      <div class="select-container">

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

              OS>Software>Enterprise<a href="/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:OS>Software>Enterprise" title="OS>Software>Enterprise = ChromeOS Enterprise/EDU-related issues

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Inside Function NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError<span class="line"><!---->Inside Function NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError<!----></span><br>On line 111 [codeptr](<span class="line"><!---->On line 111 [codeptr](<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=eed8e2118e9dd38400dbaa587adf8d2af5d576bc;l=112<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=eed8e2118e9dd38400dbaa587adf8d2af5d576bc;l=112"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=eed8e2118e9dd38400dbaa587adf8d2af5d576bc;l=112<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>The pending_promises_ are resolved in such a way that a user javascript can triggered and can invalidate range based iterator by inserting / erasing a resolver. <span class="line"><!---->The pending_promises_ are resolved in such a way that a user javascript can triggered and can invalidate range based iterator by inserting / erasing a resolver. <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError() {<span class="line"><!---->void NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError() {<!----></span><br>  device_api_service_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  device_api_service_.reset();<!----></span><br><br>  // We should reset managed configuration service only it actually got<span class="line"><!---->  // We should reset managed configuration service only it actually got<!----></span><br>  // disconnected.<span class="line"><!---->  // disconnected.<!----></span><br>  if (managed_configuration_service_.is_bound() &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (managed_configuration_service_.is_bound() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      !managed_configuration_service_.is_connected()) {<span class="line"><!---->      !managed_configuration_service_.is_connected()) {<!----></span><br>    managed_configuration_service_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->    managed_configuration_service_.reset();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  // Resolve all pending promises with a failure.<span class="line"><!---->  // Resolve all pending promises with a failure.<!----></span><br>  for (ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver : pending_promises_) { /**** 1 ****/<span class="line"><!---->  for (ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver : pending_promises_) { /**** 1 ****/<!----></span><br>    resolver->Reject(<span class="line"><!---->    resolver-&gt;Reject(<!----></span><br>        MakeGarbageCollected<DOMException>(DOMExceptionCode::kNotAllowedError,<span class="line"><!---->        MakeGarbageCollected&lt;DOMException&gt;(DOMExceptionCode::kNotAllowedError,<!----></span><br>                                           kNotHighTrustedAppExceptionMessage));<span class="line"><!---->                                           kNotHighTrustedAppExceptionMessage));<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Here's a reference issue. <span class="line"><!---->Here's a reference issue. <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773<!----></a> and old bug by sergei.<span class="line"><!----> and old bug by sergei.<!----></span><br><br>A proposed fix for this issue is we can create a set of local variable and swap the pending_promises_. <span class="line"><!---->A proposed fix for this issue is we can create a set of local variable and swap the pending_promises_. <!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [99.0.4844.51] + [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [99.0.4844.51] + [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: [All expect android]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [All expect android]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes.         Hii, i think the trigger path will be something like this.<span class="line"><!---->Hii, i think the trigger path will be something like this.<!----></span><br>NavigatorManagedData api is only available for Managed Apps. which is a normal case.<span class="line"><!---->NavigatorManagedData api is only available for Managed Apps. which is a normal case.<!----></span><br><br>1. When calling NavigatorManagedData.getManagedConfiguration() with any wrong key, for eg:- `managed_data.getManagedConfiguration(["a"]); the js calls it's c++ blink counterpart, NavigatorManagedData::getManagedConfiguration  <span class="line"><!---->1. When calling NavigatorManagedData.getManagedConfiguration() with any wrong key, for eg:- `managed_data.getManagedConfiguration(["a"]); the js calls it's c++ blink counterpart, NavigatorManagedData::getManagedConfiguration  <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=119<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=119"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=119<!----></a><br>2. This calls the GetManagedConfiguration() mojo api, using ManagedConfigurationService, and pass callback OnConfigurationReceived, (if the interface is not bound, it binds the mojo api first) <span class="line"><!---->2. This calls the GetManagedConfiguration() mojo api, using ManagedConfigurationService, and pass callback OnConfigurationReceived, (if the interface is not bound, it binds the mojo api first) <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=88<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=88"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=88<!----></a><br>3. Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->3. Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<span class="line"><!---->5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<!----></span><br>6. OnServiceConnectionError gets called, which tries to reset the api's managed_configuration_service and device_api_service, and then iterates over pending_promises_. and do Reject() which it can call v8 script which can invalidate the iterator by calling getManagedConfiguration again. (NOTE: however OnServiceConnectionError never clears the pending_promise_.) which i think it should after all promises are resolved.<span class="line"><!---->6. OnServiceConnectionError gets called, which tries to reset the api's managed_configuration_service and device_api_service, and then iterates over pending_promises_. and do Reject() which it can call v8 script which can invalidate the iterator by calling getManagedConfiguration again. (NOTE: however OnServiceConnectionError never clears the pending_promise_.) which i think it should after all promises are resolved.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->comment #2<!----></a> seems a valid fix.<span class="line"><!----> seems a valid fix.<!----></span><br><br>More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <span class="line"><!---->More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <!----></span>https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md"><!---->https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<span class="line"><!---->It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<!----></span><br>- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<span class="line"><!---->- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<!----></span><br>- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<span class="line"><!---->- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can be triggered on any platform because, the only thing required to trigger the bug is accesing the readonly attribute NavigatorManagedData managed. <span class="line"><!---->@anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
