        The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->comment #2<!----></a> seems a valid fix.<span class="line"><!----> seems a valid fix.<!----></span><br><br>More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <span class="line"><!---->More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <!----></span>https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md"><!---->https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<span class="line"><!---->It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<!----></span><br>- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<span class="line"><!---->- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<!----></span><br>- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<span class="line"><!---->- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Fixed)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Fixed)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<span class="line"><!---->Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<!----></span><br><br>The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<span class="line"><!---->The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        > 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<!----></span><br><br>The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <span class="line"><!---->The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <!----></span>crbug.com/1310338#c10<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1310338#c10" title="Security: UAF in BaseAudioContext::PerformCleanupOnMainThread"><!---->crbug.com/1310338#c10<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>> 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<!----></span><br><br>Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <span class="line"><!---->Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <!----></span>issue 1106773<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773" title="Security: Use-after-free in USB::OnServiceConnectionError"><!---->issue 1106773<!----></a>) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<span class="line"><!---->) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<!----></span><br><br>> 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<!----></span><br><br>No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<span class="line"><!---->No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError<span class="line"><!---->Inside Function NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError<!----></span><br>On line 111 [codeptr](<span class="line"><!---->On line 111 [codeptr](<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=eed8e2118e9dd38400dbaa587adf8d2af5d576bc;l=112<a href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=eed8e2118e9dd38400dbaa587adf8d2af5d576bc;l=112"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=eed8e2118e9dd38400dbaa587adf8d2af5d576bc;l=112<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>The pending_promises_ are resolved in such a way that a user javascript can triggered and can invalidate range based iterator by inserting / erasing a resolver. <span class="line"><!---->The pending_promises_ are resolved in such a way that a user javascript can triggered and can invalidate range based iterator by inserting / erasing a resolver. <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError() {<span class="line"><!---->void NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError() {<!----></span><br>  device_api_service_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  device_api_service_.reset();<!----></span><br><br>  // We should reset managed configuration service only it actually got<span class="line"><!---->  // We should reset managed configuration service only it actually got<!----></span><br>  // disconnected.<span class="line"><!---->  // disconnected.<!----></span><br>  if (managed_configuration_service_.is_bound() &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (managed_configuration_service_.is_bound() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      !managed_configuration_service_.is_connected()) {<span class="line"><!---->      !managed_configuration_service_.is_connected()) {<!----></span><br> promises with a failure.<span class="line"><!---->  // Resolve all pending promises with a failure.<!----></span><br>  for (ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver : pending_promises_) { /**** 1 ****/<span class="line"><!---->  for (ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver : pending_promises_) { /**** 1 ****/<!----></span><br>    resolver->Reject(<span class="line"><!---->    resolver-&gt;Reject(<!----></span><br>        MakeGarbageCollected<DOMException>(DOMExceptionCode::kNotAllowedError,<span class="line"><!---->                                           kNotHighTrustedAppExceptionMessage));<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span and old bug by sergei.<!----></span><br><br>A proposed fix for this issue is we can create a set of local variable and swap the pending_promises_. <span class="line"><!---->A proposed fix for this issue is we can create a set of local variable and swap the pending_promises_. <!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [99.0.4844.51] + [stable, expect android]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->3. Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<span class="line"><!---->5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<!----></span><br>6. OnServiceConnectionError gets called, which tries to reset the api's managed_configuration_service and device_api_service, and then iterates over pending_promises_. and do Reject() which it can call v8 script which can invalidate the iterator by calling getManagedConfiguration again. (NOTE: however OnServiceConnectionError never clears the pending_promise_.) which i think it should after all promises are resolved.<span class="line"><!---->6.         by

        The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->comment #2<!----></a> seems a valid fix.<span class="line"><!----> seems a valid fix.<!----></span><br><br>More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <span class="line"><!---->More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <!----></span>https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md"><!---->https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<span class="line"><!---->It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<!----></span><br>- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<span class="line"><!---->- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<!----></span><br>- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<span class="line"><!---->- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can be triggered on any platform because, the only thing required to trigger the bug is accesing the readonly attribute NavigatorManagedData managed. <span class="line"><!---->@anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError "BECAUSE" we can not bind this interface and mojo throws an error, "managed.getManagedConfiguration() pushes a ScriptPromiseResolver into `pending_promises_` when getManagedConfiguration is called <span class="line"><!---->this code will trigger the function NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError "BECAUSE" we can not bind this         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Unclear why Sheriffbot didn't ask for merges here, so I'm doing so instead.<span class="line"><!---->Unclear why Sheriffbot didn't ask for merges here, so I'm doing so instead.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307223#c46">Comment 46<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Fixed)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Fixed)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<span class="line"><!---->Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<!----></span><br><br>The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<span class="line"><!---->The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        > 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<!----></span><br><br>The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <span class="line"><!---->The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <!----></span>crbug.com/1310338#c10<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1310338#c10" title="Security: UAF in BaseAudioContext::PerformCleanupOnMainThread"><!---->crbug.com/1310338#c10<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>> 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<!----></span><br><br>Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <span class="line"><!---->Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <!----></span>issue 1106773<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773" title="Security: Use-after-free in USB::OnServiceConnectionError"><!---->issue 1106773<!----></a>) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<span class="line"><!---->) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<!----></span><br><br>> 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<!----></span><br><br>No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<span class="line"><!---->No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

iterator by inserting / erasing a resolver. <span class="line"><!---->The pending_promises_ are resolved in such a way that a user javascript can triggered and can invalidate range based iterator by inserting / erasing a resolver. <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError() {<span class="line"><!---->void managed configuration service only it actually got<span class="line"><!---->  // We should reset managed configuration service only it actually got<!----></span><br>  // disconnected.<span promises with a failure.<span class="line"><!---->  // Resolve all pending promises with a failure.<!----></span><br>  for (ScriptPromiseResolver* resolver : pending_promises_) { /**** 1 ****/<span issue is we can create a set of local variable and swap the pending_promises_. <!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [99.0.4844.51] + [stable, class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes.         Hii, i think the trigger path will be something like this.<span class="line"><!---->Hii, i think the trigger path will be something like this.<!----></span><br>NavigatorManagedData api is only available for Managed Apps. which is a normal case.<span class="line"><!---->NavigatorManagedData api is only available for Managed Apps. which is a normal case.<!----></span><br><br>1. When calling NavigatorManagedData.getManagedConfiguration() with any wrong key, for eg:- `managed_data.getManagedConfiguration(["a"]); the js calls it's c++ blink counterpart, NavigatorManagedData::getManagedConfiguration  <span class="line"><!---->1. When calling NavigatorManagedData.getManagedConfiguration() with any wrong key, for eg:- `managed_data.getManagedConfiguration(["a"]); the js calls it's c++ blink counterpart, NavigatorManagedData::getManagedConfiguration  <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=119<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=119"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=119<!----></a><br>2. This calls the GetManagedConfiguration() mojo api, using ManagedConfigurationService, and pass callback OnConfigurationReceived, (if the interface is not bound, it binds the mojo api first) <span class="line"><!---->2. This calls the GetManagedConfiguration() mojo api, using ManagedConfigurationService, and pass callback OnConfigurationReceived, (if the interface is not bound, it binds the mojo api first) <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=88<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=88"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=88<!----></a><br>3. Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->3. Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<span class="line"><!---->5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<!----></span><br>6. OnServiceConnectionError gets called, which tries to reset the api's managed_configuration_service and device_api_service, and then iterates over pending_promises_. and do Reject() which it can call v8 script which can invalidate the iterator by calling getManagedConfiguration again. (NOTE: however OnServiceConnectionError never clears the pending_promise_.) which i think it should after all promises are resolved.<span class="line"><!---->6. OnServiceConnectionError gets called, which tries to reset the api's managed_configuration_service and device_api_service, and then iterates over pending_promises_. and do Reject() which it can call v8 script which can invalidate the iterator by calling getManagedConfiguration again. (NOTE: however OnServiceConnectionError never clears the pending_promise_.) which i think it should after all promises are resolved.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->comment #2<!----></a> seems a valid fix.<span class="line"><!----> seems a valid fix.<!----></span><br><br>More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <span class="line"><!---->More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <!----></span>https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md"><!---->https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<span class="line"><!---->It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<!----></span><br>- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<span class="line"><!---->- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<!----></span><br>- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<span class="line"><!---->- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can be triggered on any platform because, the only thing required to trigger the bug is accesing the readonly attribute NavigatorManagedData managed. <span class="line"><!---->@anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can         <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-6000
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 46<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307223#c46">Comment 46<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      reillyg@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->reillyg@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        on
        
      Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307223#c46">Comment 46<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307223#c46">Comment 46<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Fixed)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Fixed)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<span class="line"><!---->Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<!----></span><br><br>The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<span class="line"><!---->The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307223#c49">Comment 49<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 2, 2022, 3:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307223#c49">Comment 49<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 2, 2022, 3:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<!----></span><br><br>The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <span class="line"><!---->The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <!----></span>crbug.com/1310338#c10<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1310338#c10" title="Security: UAF in BaseAudioContext::PerformCleanupOnMainThread"><!---->crbug.com/1310338#c10<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>> 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<!----></span><br><br>Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <span class="line"><!---->Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <!----></span>issue 1106773<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773" title="Security: Use-after-free in USB::OnServiceConnectionError"><!---->issue 1106773<!----></a>) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<span class="line"><!---->) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<!----></span><br><br>> 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<!----></span><br><br>No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<span class="line"><!---->No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template.         Hii, i think the trigger path will be something like this.<span class="line"><!---->Hii, i think the trigger path will be something like this.<!----></span><br>NavigatorManagedData api is only available for Managed Apps. which is a normal case.<span class="line"><!---->NavigatorManagedData api is only available for Managed Apps. which is a normal case.<!----></span><br><br>1. When calling NavigatorManagedData.getManagedConfiguration() with any wrong key, for eg:- `managed_data.getManagedConfiguration(["a"]); the js calls it's c++ blink counterpart, NavigatorManagedData::getManagedConfiguration  <span class="line"><!---->1. When calling NavigatorManagedData.getManagedConfiguration() with any wrong key, for eg:- `managed_data.getManagedConfiguration(["a"]); the js calls it's c++ blink counterpart, NavigatorManagedData::getManagedConfiguration  <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=119<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=119"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=119<!----></a><br>2. This calls the GetManagedConfiguration() mojo api, using ManagedConfigurationService, and pass callback OnConfigurationReceived, (if the interface is not bound, it binds the mojo api first) <span class="line"><!---->2. This calls the GetManagedConfiguration() mojo api, using ManagedConfigurationService, and pass callback OnConfigurationReceived, (if the interface is not bound, it binds the mojo api first) <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=88<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=88"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/managed_device/navigator_managed_data.cc;drc=88989bcd7983c93c8d294e1472160d0718299f62;l=88<!----></a><br>3. Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->3. Where it set (set_disconnect_handler_) which is the NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<span class="line"><!---->4. The disconnect_handler will get called when a mojo error happens, as in ManagedConfigurationService is only available for managed apps, and this will not bind the interface, and call OnServiceConnectionError.<!----></span><br>5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<span class="line"><!---->5. When calling getManagedConfiguration the script_resolver was inserted before binding the api.<!----></span><br>6. OnServiceConnectionError gets called, which tries to reset the api's managed_configuration_service and device_api_service, and then iterates over pending_promises_. and do Reject() which it can call v8 script which can invalidate the iterator by calling getManagedConfiguration again. (NOTE: however OnServiceConnectionError never clears the pending_promise_.) which i think it should after all promises are resolved.<span class="line"><!---->6. OnServiceConnectionError gets called, which tries to reset the api's managed_configuration_service and device_api_service, and then iterates over pending_promises_. and do Reject() which it can call v8 script which can invalidate the iterator by calling getManagedConfiguration again. (NOTE: however OnServiceConnectionError never clears the pending_promise_.) which i think it should after all promises are resolved.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->comment #2<!----></a> seems a valid fix.<span class="line"><!----> seems a valid fix.<!----></span><br><br>More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <span class="line"><!---->More context: navigator.managed.* namespace is designed to provide web APIs for managed applications. So it is NOT reachable from Chrome apps. (See explainer: <!----></span>https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md"><!---->https://github.com/WICG/WebApiDevice/blob/main/Explainer.md<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<span class="line"><!---->It mainly contains two sets of web APIs.<!----></span><br>- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<span class="line"><!---->- Managed Configuration: available to all managed Chrome Browser.<!----></span><br>- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<span class="line"><!---->- Device Attributes: available to Chrome OS only.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can be triggered on any platform because, the only thing required to trigger the bug is accesing the readonly attribute NavigatorManagedData managed. <span class="line"><!---->@anqing, even though this api is only available for chrome managed apps and chrome-os, i think this still can NavigatorManagedData::OnServiceConnectionError "BECAUSE" we can not bind this interface and mojo throws an error, "managed.getManagedConfiguration() pushes a ScriptPromiseResolver into         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<span class="line"><!---->1. Have the changes been released and tested on canary?<span class="line"><!---->3. Have the changes been released and tested on canary?<!----></span><br>4. Is this a new feature? If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<span class="line"><!---->4. Is this a new feature? If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<!----></span><br>5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <span class="line"><!---->5.           Comment 46<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307223#c46">Comment 46<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      reillyg@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/816690703" title="reillyg@chromium.org"><!---->reillyg@chromium.org<!----></a>
      reillyg@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->reillyg@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307223#c46">Comment 46<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307223#c46">Comment 46<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, May 1, 2022, 12:38 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Fixed)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Fixed)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->It does not appear that a proof-of-concent was ever provided for this issue. As discussed on previous bugs, a call to ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() **cannot** synchronously execute script and so there is no opportunity for iterator invalidation and use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<span class="line"><!---->Security team, please be on the lookout for bugs like this. It appears that security researchers have been filing lots of bug reports for this pattern despite deeper analysis showing that it is unexploitable. I'm going to assume that there is no malicious intent, it took us awhile to figure out that there was no danger here, but we need to be aware that this pattern exists in many parts of Blink and so there are lots of opportunities for incorrect reports.<!----></span><br><br>The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<span class="line"><!---->The changes on this issue should be reverted to avoid leaving incorrect advice in the code (comments about rejecting executing script). Re-opening and leaving the assignment on anqing@ to take care of that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by

      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        Thank you for the insight reillyg@ and thank you for the insight. Apologies that this got passed along as there was a lot of discussion of how we should handle this sort issue all things considering and it was decided to err on the side of caution and treat this as an issue with potential security consequences. Updating labeling and updating labeling accordingly.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the insight reillyg@ and thank you for the insight. Apologies that this got passed along as there was a lot of discussion of how we should handle this sort issue all things considering and it was decided to err on the side of caution and treat this as an issue with potential security consequences. Updating labeling and updating labeling accordingly.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 1. Could you please link to discussions about how ScriptPromiseResolver::Reject() cannot synchronously execute script?<!----></span><br><br>The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <span class="line"><!---->The definitive discussion about this class of bug was on <!----></span>crbug.com/1310338#c10<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1310338#c10" title="Security: UAF in BaseAudioContext::PerformCleanupOnMainThread"><!---->crbug.com/1310338#c10<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>> 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 2. What about ScriptPromiseResolver::Resolve()?<!----></span><br><br>Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <span class="line"><!---->Resolve() is fine and also cannot synchronously execute. Resolve(/* some JS value */) is not, because if an attacker can add a custom getter for the "then" property of the JS value (as was demonstrated in <!----></span>issue 1106773<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1106773" title="Security: Use-after-free in USB::OnServiceConnectionError"><!---->issue 1106773<!----></a>) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<span class="line"><!---->) then they can synchronously execute script during resolution.<!----></span><br><br>> 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 3. Anything similar I should be on the lookout for? Is there another X::Reject() that **does** run the risk of synchronous script execution?<!----></span><br><br>No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<span class="line"><!---->No, Resolve() and Reject() are completely safe. You only need to be careful when resolving with an actual value. These cases are usually not found in loops. For example, all the cases where NavigatorManagedData calls Resolve() with a value it is the last expression of the function and so not vulnerable to re-entrancy.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
